review_title: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_body: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.

But it seems to help a little with anxiety if I take it as recommended (70ml) during the day. I will probably buy iy again.

brand: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

review_title: Don't use everyday. Otherwise it's excellent!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
review_body: If you have liver problems, don't use it as it has Kava Kava. Don't use it every day either. With that said, I have to say that this extract is amazing. I put it into water and it turns into a cloudy white color. The taste isn't bad, but very herbal. Usually within 20 minutes of taking a dose, I feel very tranquil and relaxed and ready for sleep. It is really good for when I have to wake up early the next morning and can't seem to wind down early enough for bedtime. Before, I would lie awake for hours staring at the ceiling until the first sunlight started coming through the window, knowing I'd have to get up in an hour or so. Now when I need it, I can lay down and fall asleep peacefully. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs an occasional herbal sleep aid.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2012
review_body: I've had amazing successes  with kava/poppy. My recent experiences were related to playing solos and juries (end of the semester tests/reviews before the music faculty) during my undergrad education--I majored in music. At this time, my anxiety was just starting to emerge into a problem. I took the recommended dose, on the low side, and found it did wonders to "take the edge off" and allow me to automatically relax my breathing and heart rate and not follow any negative trains of thought. It had a tranquil, peaceful emotional effect as well. But subtle.  One final note, I've noticed a more immediate and profound effect from Sense herbal mix tincture than from taking these herbs earlier in any form separately. Weird. May be this is because they were grown in Hawaii?

brand: California Poppy
name: California Poppy
description: Dietary Supplement. Promotes Relaxation*. Restful Sleep. Pain And Discomfort.
features: California Poppy seed
review_title: Works!  Must have at all times...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_body: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

review_body: It‚Äôs a Friday night, and I‚Äôm staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I‚Äôd tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different‚Äîa bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I‚Äôd heard these were supposed to be nature‚Äôs way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn‚Äôt paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity‚Äîwho knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I‚Äôm not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I‚Äôd hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn‚Äôt feel groggy or out of it‚Äîjust calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

review_body: I was skeptical when I looked up these herbs. However I know they can have a muscle relaxer effect along with a sedative affect. As soon as I received them I fell asleep within 30 minutes and woke up refreshed. I broke my neck years ago and now I am facing paralysis. This has been a great addition to my regular meds and herbs to combat pain and sleeping issues. I think everyone should give this a try and you will be pleasantly surprised how well and how fresh these herbs work.

review_body: First of I do love poppyseed. As a European it is common to have it come in breads and other bakery items. It certainly didn't knock me out and that is not supposed to be in any way. But it helps me to fall asleep more natural and I have no quarrels about that.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
review_body: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. üôÇ)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
review_body: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me.  I struggle with a lot of chronic pain that is made worse by tension and anxiety, it's like a vicious cycle so I wanted to find something to help break that cycle and hopefully help my body and mind relax.  I decided to give these a try and I am super glad I did.  The first time I took these I started to relax and my muscles started to loosen and some of the pain eased up and in turned eased my mind.....these are now a regular supplement, especially while I wait to be scheduled for hip replacement (yeah....ouch).  I sleep better now and that helps immensely!  I'll be back for more!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2023
review_body: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. Even a little fuzzy, which is not a great description for some people but it explains how I feel. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I‚Äôm enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.

Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

review_title: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
review_body: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I‚Äôm not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you‚Äôre too wound up to sleep.

review_title: Feel benefits to relaxing for sleep.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
review_body: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

review_title: Bought as a stand-in for my usual sleep supplement, but now I'm adding it in my regular regimen!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
review_body: I am a very light sleeper with a racing mind. My biggest issue is not falling asleep, but staying asleep particularly in the morning hours. My brain is so active that I can "worry myself awake". Very frustrating!The tried-and-true supplement I rely on is RidgeCrest Herbs DreamOn Zen formula. I take TWO doses because of my mind's ability to bust through the herbs and think myself awake anyway.BUT with this, I took two doses and slept very very soundly through the night AND morning! Yay! And I have vivid long dreams which I LOVE.The only potential negative, which I do not care about and do not personally consider to be negative, is that compared to the DreamOn Zen, it doesn't help me fall asleep. I don't have issues falling asleep, but I do notice now that something about DreamOn Zen helped make me feel sleepier and go to sleep faster.My new plan is to take one dose of this plus one dose of DreamOn Zen instead of two doses of either one separately.So if your brain situation sounds like mine, try this. And honestly I also highly recommend trying DreamOn Zen too.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
review_body: I have trouble sleeping and know that what may work for others sometimes may not work for me. However, the Secret of the Tribe‚Äôs promise of full refund is what makes it a scam. After trying their product and finding that it did nothing for me, even after more than doubling the recommended dosage I tried to return it and ended on a chat that supposedly approved my return, but could not tell me where to mail the product. It told me to use the rerun address in my confirmation email, but there was no return address in said email. Then I was directed to call the customer service line, but when I did what I got was a recoded message selling me new products and subscriptions. And though I said I wasn‚Äôt interested I was transferred to said promotions, since it was a non interactive recording, which transferred to the promotional line regardless of my response. There was no life person to talk to. In other words I got approval to return, but was given zero directions or guidance on how to make said return.I call that a scam.

brand: California Poppy and Valerian Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Tincture Supplement 2x4 oz
name: California Poppy and Valerian Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Tincture Supplement 2x4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. features: USDA Organic Calming Kava: An Herbal Blend to Help Achieve Homeostasis! If you‚Äôd like to help promote feelings of calmness and relaxation, this blend of 8 herbs may help. review_title: Kava Can Be Addicting, That Should Be on the Labeling
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
review_body: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

brand: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
review_body: These pills are a godsend they are narcotic-free and really help to manage my pain. The other day I was cooking up a storm and had been in the kitchen for hours, my feet and back were hurting. I took a couple of these babies and before I knew it the foot pain was gone, I felt good enough to go for an hour and a half drive and visit with my daughter (she was up late settling into her own place). Mind you I didn't get back home till 2 o'clock in the morning and I felt pretty good pain wise. That was my first time taking this supplement, now I usually take 2 or 3 at a time- once or twice a day- depending on how bad I feel, I have been diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. I saw that the Medical Medium has a California poppy seed shock therapy in his new Brain Protocols book and will give that a try soon.

brand: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count
name: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count
description: Bio Nutrition California Poppy has been used as a natural remedy to promote relaxation.
features: Promotes relaxation | Restful sleep | Helps with pain and discomfort
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2017
review_body: This supplement did not help my back pain when my back went out so I'm not sure what type of pain relief it is capable of giving. However I do notice that when I take it I sleep for a little longer than normal. Sometimes it makes me feel sleepy and I yawn but other times it just knocks me out and so I only take it a little before bedtime. This is a sedative so use with caution. And consult with your doctor before taking. I got this because it said it would help with early morning awakenings. At least that is what the magazine article said. Sometimes I awaken in the middle of the night but usually can easily get back to sleep. So don't be surprised if you sleep longer than normal.~The Rebecca Review

review_title: Very pretty and lovely. Wild flower.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review_body: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
review_body: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It‚Äôs got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can‚Äôt speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

review_title: An amazing herb tinctured by a great brand in my opinion...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
review_body: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don‚Äôt travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I‚Äôm taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I‚Äôve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I‚Äôm a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there‚Äôs still some energy to spare. I‚Äôm very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It‚Äôs very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I‚Äôm often working double shifts a day and I‚Äôm feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it‚Äôs not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I‚Äôm in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I‚Äôve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it‚Äôs certified organic too. It‚Äôs fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it‚Äôs hard for me to get a ‚Äúfull‚Äù dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there‚Äôs no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don‚Äôt have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally ‚Äî the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don‚Äôt have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I‚Äôd have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I‚Äôll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it‚Äôs such a strange combination of flavors I‚Äôm not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I‚Äôd prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. review_title: Keto-approved! It works and no extra carbs!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
review_body: I love this stuff. As a pediatric nurse, I take numerous measures to make sure I stay well and don‚Äôt bring any illnesses to my patients. One of those measures is a daily dose of high dose elderberry. I used to take Sambucus Immune, but I‚Äôve recently started the keto diet and that particular liquid formula has 8 carbs per serving, so it‚Äôs a no go for me (but my daughter stays well on it)! This product is the highest strength I‚Äôve found available in capsule form. I‚Äôve been taking this product over 30 days and during that time, I‚Äôve been in close quarters with several people with viruses like norovirus (stomach flu) and only once did I feel just a little queasy for one afternoon. I took a double dose that night and the next morning I felt at 100%. After that, I go ahead and double up when I‚Äôm knowingly around someone sick. Ultimately, I‚Äôm very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone.

review_title: I recommend this to all my family and friends if they ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2015
review_body: Black elderberry from GAIA is the real thing. I recommend this to all my family and friends if they are getting sick. I take it every time I feel like I am "coming down with something" and within 24 hours I am completely better!  It is great to take daily to keep from getting sick during the winter when lots of viruses and such are going around. I even opened up the capsule and poured into some food for my 4 year old when she was sick with a bad cold and she felt better that same day. I 100% stand behind this product from GAIA.  It's also good for those with allergies and can help minimize symptoms if taken daily or reduce the need for allergy medicine.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2017
review_body: ** UPDATED FOR JUNE 2017, scroll down to read ** Bought twice. The first time I ordered a bottle I got Liquid Phyto-Capsules, the second time I ordered I recived capsules that seemed to either have powder in them or the liquid has dried up. The date on the bottle says 10/19, so I'm pretty sure they're not expired. I've been taking them like I normally would, but it's just...odd, because I know they're not supposed to look like this (unless they've changed?). I will still order these, I'm just confused. Hopefully I won't get sick or anything, I have 34 capsules left and I take two every morning.UPDATE: 6/12/17So I ordered another bottle a few days ago and received the bottle, to which on the box it stated that it was a new and improved formula. The capsules looked exactly like the ones that inspired me to write this review, they looked like the capsules in the picture. So the company finally got around to making it official that they changed the formula, on the box. I can't say for sure if this new formula works better than the old one, as I was sure that they were onto something with the liquid inside the capsule. Oh well. I ordered the elderberry syrup as well (not the nighttime one) and I take that sometimes when I need the extra help and want the benefits of having the liquid. So I guess just be aware that there's the change to the formula. Too bad they couldn't have just made another version of this capsule and kept this one with liquid inside. But I guess they know what they're doing.

review_title: recommended this to us two years ago and since then ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
review_body: My friend's twin sister, a midwife, recommended this to us two years ago and since then it's helped boost my immunity to every sniffle that comes around, and has made my allergies more manageable. I love this stuff. There's an increasing amount of scientific literature proving the efficacy of elderberry extract in immunity boosting. Amazon has the best prices on Gaia (60 for the price of 30 at Whole Foods), and the capsules are easy to swallow, whereas the syrup is very, very sweet and can be off putting. All of that being said, after six months of ordering it, I have to share this photo of the packaging to shame Amazon into a less wasteful shipping method. The box of capsules in a bubble wrap lined envelope would work just as well.

review_title: Who knew the benefits of black elderberry....
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
review_body: I have an autoimmune disease called Sarcoidosis that affects my lungs.  I get a lot of mucus build up and non-stop episodes of coughing.  On a whim, I was doing some Google-ing and found the recommendation for black elderberry.  I of course headed over to my favorite store (Amazon) and found the Gaia capsules, ordered a bottle to give them a try.  Wow!  They seem work almost instantaneously to break up the mucus and help to suppress the coughing.  I don't need to take them every day but I have reordered them twice and will continue to order to keep them in my cabinet.

brand: BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops, Herbal Sleep Aid, 1 Ounce
name: BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops, Herbal Sleep Aid, 1 Ounce
description: Sweet Dreams Liquid Drops blend organic ingredients in an herbal sleep aid that help quiet the mind to support restful sleep. BareOrganics Sweet Dreams Drops are made with organic Valerian, Skullcap, Hops, Passion Flower, California Poppy and Chamomile for optimal wellness support. These liquid valerian drops are available in a compact vial and do not need to be refrigerated, making them ideal for those with active, on-the-go lifestyles. The BareOrganics Liquid Drops are developed without harsh chemicals or ingredients, and are proudly USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Kosher and Gluten & Alcohol-Free. This herbal supplement comes in a 1 ounce recyclable dropper bottle. The drops should be shaken before each use.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
review_body: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It‚Äôs got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can‚Äôt speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

review_title: An amazing herb tinctured by a great brand in my opinion...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
review_body: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don‚Äôt travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I‚Äôm taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I‚Äôve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I‚Äôm a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there‚Äôs still some energy to spare. I‚Äôm very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It‚Äôs very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I‚Äôm often working double shifts a day and I‚Äôm feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it‚Äôs not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I‚Äôm in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I‚Äôve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

name: Herb Pharm Organic Valerian Root Liquid Extract, Alcohol-Free: Sleep & Relaxing, Calming Nighttime Sleep Support Supplement, Sugar-Free Herbal Supplement, 1 Oz
description: Herb Pharm Certified Organic Valerian root extract works with the body's natural mechanisms to support relaxation and restful sleep*. Herb Pharm prepares Valerian extract from fresh (never dried) rhizome & roots of Valeriana officinalis plants which are Certified Organically Grown on our own farm. To assure optimal extraction of Valerian's bioactive compounds, the rhizome & roots are hand-harvested in autumn or spring and are then promptly extracted while still fresh and succulent. Valerian is bitter sharp and aromatic. It may be added to water or other liquid for taste and is easily absorbed into the bloodstream. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979. *These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.
features: HERBAL ORGANIC SLEEP SUPPLEMENT: Experience restful sleep support with our organic Valerian root extract, a liquid herbal extract designed to promote relaxation. Ideal for those seeking a gentle calm nighttime sleep without harsh ingredients.* | CALMING VALERIAN ROOT EXTRACT WITH QUICK ABSORPTION: Our sleep support supplement is in an easily absorbed liquid form, ensuring relaxation and a restful sleep.* | CERTIFIED & POTENT NIGHTTIME SUPPLEMENT: Prepared from the Certified Organic fresh rhizome and root of Valeriana officinalis plants on our USA farms, we create a high-quality Valerian root tincture for a calming supplement.* | HIGH-QUALITY & RESPONSIBLE - Enjoy the peace of mind with an alcohol-free, vegan, non-GMO, & gluten-free Valerian root tincture. Offering up to 42 nights of restful sleep support per 1 oz bottle, suitable for daily use.* | VALERIAN SLEEP SUPPLEMENT FOR ADULTS - Not just supporting your sleep, our Valerian root for sleep aligns with healthy lifestyles, supporting relaxation. It's free from additives and made from clean ingredients.*
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
review_body: IDK if its placebo or what.. the moment I take drops of this thing I can sense a calmness and relaxtion. It has helped me calm my nerves and sleep like a baby. First day i took it three times a day.. second i felt better so i took it an hour before sleep and one more right before bed. Since then  I only need to take it before bed.. it has really helped me feel out of a funk i've been in for days. Currently buying my second bottle to keep at work.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
review_body: This is the only product I've used that helps me fall asleep, stay asleep, and does not make me feel groggy in the morning. Warning though, it doesn't taste the best, but it's derived from a root, so I wasn't expecting much. I usually mix it with a sip of water, throw it back, and chase it with another sip of water.I love that it works quickly, but I can still function if my kids need me. I've not experienced any side effects or adverse effects.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2016
review_body: I habe been taking valerian for a while intermittently to help me sleep. The liquid works better and faster than pill form. I was so thrilled to fund some affordable ones on amazon because it's difficult to justify a trip to sprouts for just one item and I have 2 small kids to tote around. This is a great quality product. It doesn't habe the alcohol burn like some Valerian liquids do. It does taste terrible when you first use it, but it doesn't really bother me. You kinda ha e to experiment with how much you need, I usually use about 1/4 to 1/2 of the dropper to get the effect I want.  This is also good for headaches and for relaxing as well. It works well for me as a sleep aid. I take it 30 minutes before I intend to go to sleep and it works amazingly!  No groggy feeling in the morning unless I took too much, but it's not like taking a sleeping pill or benadryl sort of groggy. I've never missed my alarm or slept til noon with this. Like I said experiment with how much you need. A while dropper full was too much for me and I'm slim,  5'6, in my mid 30s, for a reference, if size plays a part or just show tolerant you are with sleep aids.  Hope this helps!  Gove it a try, I promise it's worth it for a good night's sleep!!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
review_body: I can't remember when I started using this Valerian product. I'm not a good flyer, and that's probably the reason I tried it the first time. If you get a bit anxious about getting locked into a "bus" with 200 strangers and taken up to 30 or 40 thousand feet, I suggest you try this Valerian. You will probably have to try how much to take depending on your size, height, etc. I would suggest you try it out on the ground first. And of course you should always check with your physician, and check out any interaction possibilities with anything else, medications, alcohol, etc. I find it helpful for many stressful situations; but anything like this, herbal or not, is a very personal choice. I find this to be a mild herbal helper for all types of stressful situations. Also, I have not found it to be addictive. It's just there when I need it. Honestly, sometimes i forget to take it, and I learn that I was more courageous than I gave myself credit for. Do your due diligence checking it out for yourself first. For some people it is a great help.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review_body: I have NO idea if this would help my Mom because there's no possible way to take this orally. review_title: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
review_body: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

review_body: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

features: Expertly extracted to provide calming support to the nervous system | Prepared from certified organic, fresh whole Eschschoizia californica plants grown on our own southern Oregon farms | Gluten-free and non-GMO | Gentle enough to use with children | Herb potency assured through High Performance Thin Layer Chromatography (HPTLC) analysis
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
review_body: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2012
review_body: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
review_body: I bought this to add to a herbal sleep remedy. I find that it works very well, it has certainly improved the quality of my sleep. Like most herbal remedies it takes a while to work. ( i don,t think that there are any quick fixes in herbal medicine)  The quality, i have used a number of tinctures from this company and they all seem to be of high quality, i have every confidence in them. As for the taste, most herbal tinctures taste awful. (why would anyone think it would taste nice?) However the taste is not that bad and is quite easily masked in a drink of some sort. If you are suffering with insomnia and/or anxiety, this is well worth a try. It is more effective mixed with other calming herbs than on its own though.

review_title: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
review_body: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called ‚Äúglutamate‚Äù which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don‚Äôt feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you‚Äôre increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I‚Äôve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

review_title: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2015
review_body: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.

review_title: Works well for minor pain or sleep problems
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2013
review_body: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

review_title: Was surprised by Poppy Extract effectiveness.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2013
review_body: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2012
review_body: When I first took this I was confused because it says for sleep. The 1st night I had a wild dream, The 2nd night, I noticed I awoke and was so rested. Not tired. I continued to take it, but thought it was making my heart race (which it wasn't) so i stopped taking it. I began to get stiff and sore as I awoke and it hit me that after the week I had taken it I was pain free. I then remembered it was for pain as one of "DR OZ'S so called expert had mentioned on the things drug companies DON'T want you to know. I have to say this one did the control the pain!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2013
review_body: I wouldn't buy my tinctures from any other source, they are caring and their quality is top notch, I have tried several other brands and even bought for awhile from a person who makes her own, (not advisable bc of hygenics)...  Hawaii pharm has this down pact!!!From a hopeful, personal point of view...I successfully weaned myself off of opiates with the use of California Poppy..I was taking 4 pills a day for over 8 years!!..I decided to try it on the advice of a local Herbalist who'd owed a store for many years, I tried it, it took a couple weeks to adjust and make allowances for "extra pain" I didn't experience with the opiate, BUT, it is worth giving up more physical activity to not be controlled by a substance that 1) "knocks you out"..2) causes organ damage,sleeplessness, trauma (such as sweats, diareah ,constipation, vomiting if you cannot get it)...It is more like a "whole " body pain relief, not so generalized..and no negative side effects.( and my doctor is on board with it!!)

review_title: Best sleep aid I've ever used.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2013
review_body: I've used many sleep aids, from melatonin to other over the counter stuff. None compare to just 5-10 drops of california poppy. I typically add it to my night time tea, it has a sweet very tolerable taste. Puts me in a very relaxed mood, I never wake up groggy like other medicines, feels very natural. Unlike melatonin, you don't build up a tolerance to this, atleast I haven't through months of using it nearly every night. I've bought a bottle for my girlfriend and mother and plan to buy more as gifts. Nothing better than a great nights rest.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2012
review_body: I have fibromyalgia and have avoided using pharmaceuticals as much as possible. However, about once a month, my pain is so intense that I need something to break through the pain. I decided to try this since it was touted as a more natural alternative to the codones...and man, has it been a life saver! I just bought some passionflower and st.john's wort in dried form from another source to use as a calming tea at night, since sleep deprivation is one of the biggest issues in my fibromyalgia. I'm excited to see how those will work together. But as far as this product - it truly has been a life-saver and I'm only sorry that I waited so long to order the second bottle!

review_title: After 2 weeks on it I can sleep more than 4 hours.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2013
review_body: I work 3rd shift and have always been a night person but I have a hard time falling asleep and staying asleep even with Ambian.  I take it 2 times a day not 3  like recomended and I love it it has changed my life.  I'm not exausted all the time, I can think better, I sleep alot more now. I dont have kids,and I work 3rd shift, I have on and off health problems, so there are days I real have nothing I have to do and I have been able to sleep most of the day and evening which is fine with me, my body so can use the rest to heal itself.  And when I have stuff to do I'm not falling asleep tired when I have things to do because I'm sleeping Good when I do sleep.  I highly recomend this to anyone who's mind races when they got to bed. I use to get up and write things and draw scetches of products I should invent that was how fast my mind would race, or thinking I should be doing dishes or laundry or what ever task.  NowI lay down and I couldnt even tell you what my brain is thinking of and off to sleep I go. TRY IT !!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2015
review_body: I am not a lucid dreamer so can not report on the product's effectiveness if that is your objective. I purchased as a sleep aid, and I am unsure if it helps me to sleep. I do believe that I have better dream recollection when I take it, and that my dreams may be more intense. Alas, as a light sleeper, I sometimes wake from the intensity of a dream, so as a sleep aid it isn't helping, but as an entertainment, it is. As for the taste, I happen to really and truly like the taste. To me it is delicious, almost sweet, and I enjoy allowing the tincture to linger in my mouth for the needed absorption time.

review_body: I've had three lower spine surgeries in the past seven years and still have nerve pain that prevents me from getting a good night's sleep.  I don't want to rely strictly on prescription drugs for the rest of my life, so I tried this.  It doesn't solve all of my problems, but it does help, and I'll continue with it.  P.S. - I use 20 drops of the tincture in water before bed.  Any more and I get VERY sleepy very fast.  If that's your aim, then this might be worth a try.

review_title: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_body: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.

But it seems to help a little with anxiety if I take it as recommended (70ml) during the day. I will probably buy iy again.

brand: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and St John's Wort Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and St John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August. The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Kava Kava (Piper Methysticum) is an upright, dioecious, evergreen shrub that grows to 10-15‚Äô tall with glossy dark green leaves. It grows on a number of South Pacific islands (Micronesia, Fiji, Hawaii, New Guinea, the Samoas, Tonga and Vanuatu), but the specific place of origin is unknown. Male plants produce short spikes of small creamy white flowers, but female plants rarely flower.

review_title: Don't use everyday. Otherwise it's excellent!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
review_body: If you have liver problems, don't use it as it has Kava Kava. Don't use it every day either. With that said, I have to say that this extract is amazing. I put it into water and it turns into a cloudy white color. The taste isn't bad, but very herbal. Usually within 20 minutes of taking a dose, I feel very tranquil and relaxed and ready for sleep. It is really good for when I have to wake up early the next morning and can't seem to wind down early enough for bedtime. Before, I would lie awake for hours staring at the ceiling until the first sunlight started coming through the window, knowing I'd have to get up in an hour or so. Now when I need it, I can lay down and fall asleep peacefully. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs an occasional herbal sleep aid.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2012
review_body: I've had amazing successes  with kava/poppy. My recent experiences were related to playing solos and juries (end of the semester tests/reviews before the music faculty) during my undergrad education--I majored in music. At this time, my anxiety was just starting to emerge into a problem. I took the recommended dose, on the low side, and found it did wonders to "take the edge off" and allow me to automatically relax my breathing and heart rate and not follow any negative trains of thought. It had a tranquil, peaceful emotional effect as well. But subtle.  One final note, I've noticed a more immediate and profound effect from Sense herbal mix tincture than from taking these herbs earlier in any form separately. Weird. May be this is because they were grown in Hawaii?

brand: California Poppy
name: California Poppy
description: Dietary Supplement. Promotes Relaxation*. Restful Sleep. Pain And Discomfort.
features: California Poppy seed
review_title: Works!  Must have at all times...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_body: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

review_body: It‚Äôs a Friday night, and I‚Äôm staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I‚Äôd tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different‚Äîa bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I‚Äôd heard these were supposed to be nature‚Äôs way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn‚Äôt paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity‚Äîwho knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I‚Äôm not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I‚Äôd hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn‚Äôt feel groggy or out of it‚Äîjust calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

review_body: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland.  I use a few different products which I rotate every three days, since that seems to keep their effects potent.  I had never tried wild lettuce or California poppy extract before.  I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. üôÇ)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

review_body: This was my very first experience with wild lettuce and poppyseed and I'm pleasantly surprised at how effective they are for me.  I struggle with a lot of chronic pain that is made worse by tension and anxiety, it's like a vicious cycle so I wanted to find something to help break that cycle and hopefully help my body and mind relax.  I decided to give these a try and I am super glad I did.  The first time I took these I started to relax and my muscles started to loosen and some of the pain eased up and in turned eased my mind.....these are now a regular supplement, especially while I wait to be scheduled for hip replacement (yeah....ouch).  I sleep better now and that helps immensely!  I'll be back for more!

review_title: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
review_body: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

review_title: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
review_body: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I‚Äôm not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you‚Äôre too wound up to sleep.

review_title: Feel benefits to relaxing for sleep.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
review_body: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
review_body: I was looking for something all natural for anxiety and sleep other than melatonin and kava kava. I was intrigued to try the California Poppy supplement as I've never considered it before.It arrived sealed and I checked the expiration date and it had a good year and a half or so before expiration.I used it for a week straight just at bedtime. It seemed to work most of the time. Then I decided to try one on a Saturday morning around 10am to see how it helped with anxiety. It didn't seem to have much of an effect,if any. However, that's not to say they won't work for someone else. I did continue to use it AM and PM for a couple of weeks and for me, it doesn't seem to have much of an effect during the daytime that I could tell. But for sleep, it helped most of the time.

review_title: Bought as a stand-in for my usual sleep supplement, but now I'm adding it in my regular regimen!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
review_body: I am a very light sleeper with a racing mind. My biggest issue is not falling asleep, but staying asleep particularly in the morning hours. My brain is so active that I can "worry myself awake". Very frustrating!The tried-and-true supplement I rely on is RidgeCrest Herbs DreamOn Zen formula. I take TWO doses because of my mind's ability to bust through the herbs and think myself awake anyway.BUT with this, I took two doses and slept very very soundly through the night AND morning! Yay! And I have vivid long dreams which I LOVE.The only potential negative, which I do not care about and do not personally consider to be negative, is that compared to the DreamOn Zen, it doesn't help me fall asleep. I don't have issues falling asleep, but I do notice now that something about DreamOn Zen helped make me feel sleepier and go to sleep faster.My new plan is to take one dose of this plus one dose of DreamOn Zen instead of two doses of either one separately.So if your brain situation sounds like mine, try this. And honestly I also highly recommend trying DreamOn Zen too.
