review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
review_body: I have trouble sleeping and know that what may work for others sometimes may not work for me. However, the Secret of the Tribe‚Äôs promise of full refund is what makes it a scam. After trying their product and finding that it did nothing for me, even after more than doubling the recommended dosage I tried to return it and ended on a chat that supposedly approved my return, but could not tell me where to mail the product. It told me to use the rerun address in my confirmation email, but there was no return address in said email. Then I was directed to call the customer service line, but when I did what I got was a recoded message selling me new products and subscriptions. And though I said I wasn‚Äôt interested I was transferred to said promotions, since it was a non interactive recording, which transferred to the promotional line regardless of my response. There was no life person to talk to. In other words I got approval to return, but was given zero directions or guidance on how to make said return.I call that a scam.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

review_title: Kava Can Be Addicting, That Should Be on the Labeling
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
review_body: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

review_body: I take one capsule an hour before I go to bed and I sleep like a baby! Wake up feeling rested and no residual after effects! A natural way to fall asleep‚Ä¶what could be better?!

brand: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count

description: Bio Nutrition California Poppy has been used as a natural remedy to promote relaxation.
features: Promotes relaxation | Restful sleep | Helps with pain and discomfort
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
review_body: These pills are a godsend they are narcotic-free and really help to manage my pain. The other day I was cooking up a storm and had been in the kitchen for hours, my feet and back were hurting. I took a couple of these babies and before I knew it the foot pain was gone, I felt good enough to go for an hour and a half drive and visit with my daughter (she was up late settling into her own place). Mind you I didn't get back home till 2 o'clock in the morning and I felt pretty good pain wise. That was my first time taking this supplement, now I usually take 2 or 3 at a time- once or twice a day- depending on how bad I feel, I have been diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. I saw that the Medical Medium has a California poppy seed shock therapy in his new Brain Protocols book and will give that a try soon.

brand: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count
name: Bio Nutrition California Poppy Vegi-Caps, 60 Count
description: Bio Nutrition California Poppy has been used as a natural remedy to promote relaxation.
features: Promotes relaxation | Restful sleep | Helps with pain and discomfort
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2017
review_body: This supplement did not help my back pain when my back went out so I'm not sure what type of pain relief it is capable of giving. However I do notice that when I take it I sleep for a little longer than normal. Sometimes it makes me feel sleepy and I yawn but other times it just knocks me out and so I only take it a little before bedtime. This is a sedative so use with caution. And consult with your doctor before taking. I got this because it said it would help with early morning awakenings. At least that is what the magazine article said. Sometimes I awaken in the middle of the night but usually can easily get back to sleep. So don't be surprised if you sleep longer than normal.~The Rebecca Review

review_title: Very pretty and lovely. Wild flower.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
review_body: The seeds bloomed. The flowers are pretty and lovely just as you imagine what California poppy should look like. I learned that wild flowers don't like transplanting. When I tried to transplant from the ground to the pots, I didn't succeed. All failed. Next time, when I want to share California poppy with others, I will scatter the seeds on the dirt in the pot and place them on the ground. Thank you so much for the product! Also, one friend of mine from Japan was impressed by the plants when they were before blooming, and she took a trip down to southern California to see the super bloom. She and her husband enjoyed the trip. I'm glad I had this opportunity this year so they could have a great vacation.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
review_body: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It‚Äôs got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can‚Äôt speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
review_body: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don‚Äôt travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I‚Äôm taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I‚Äôve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I‚Äôm a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there‚Äôs still some energy to spare. I‚Äôm very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It‚Äôs very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I‚Äôm often working double shifts a day and I‚Äôm feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it‚Äôs not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I‚Äôm in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I‚Äôve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

review_body: I got the one with alcohol, which was maybe my downfall. I‚Äôd already been taking Ashwagandha supplements as capsule and decided to try the tincture since my experience with the Lemon Balm was so pleasant. But that‚Äôs where I was wrong. The taste is so repugnant and lingers for minutes after unless you eat something super tart. If you try this I‚Äôd recommend chasing with a super tart lemonade or going with the non-alcohol version. I seriously don‚Äôt know if I can finish this product, as the thought of having to endure another round of this makes me vomit in my mouth a little.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it‚Äôs certified organic too. It‚Äôs fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it‚Äôs hard for me to get a ‚Äúfull‚Äù dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there‚Äôs no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don‚Äôt have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally ‚Äî the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don‚Äôt have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I‚Äôd have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I‚Äôll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it‚Äôs such a strange combination of flavors I‚Äôm not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I‚Äôd prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. Might have benefits over time, but hard to tell.

review_title: Keto-approved! It works and no extra carbs!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
review_body: I love this stuff. As a pediatric nurse, I take numerous measures to make sure I stay well and don‚Äôt bring any illnesses to my patients. One of those measures is a daily dose of high dose elderberry. I used to take Sambucus Immune, but I‚Äôve recently started the keto diet and that particular liquid formula has 8 carbs per serving, so it‚Äôs a no go for me (but my daughter stays well on it)! This product is the highest strength I‚Äôve found available in capsule form. I‚Äôve been taking this product over 30 days and during that time, I‚Äôve been in close quarters with several people with viruses like norovirus (stomach flu) and only once did I feel just a little queasy for one afternoon. I took a double dose that night and the next morning I felt at 100%. After that, I go ahead and double up when I‚Äôm knowingly around someone sick. Ultimately, I‚Äôm very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone.

review_title: I recommend this to all my family and friends if they ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2015
review_body: Black elderberry from GAIA is the real thing. I recommend this to all my family and friends if they are getting sick. I take it every time I feel like I am "coming down with something" and within 24 hours I am completely better!  It is great to take daily to keep from getting sick during the winter when lots of viruses and such are going around. I even opened up the capsule and poured into some food for my 4 year old when she was sick with a bad cold and she felt better that same day. I 100% stand behind this product from GAIA.  It's also good for those with allergies and can help minimize symptoms if taken daily or reduce the need for allergy medicine.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2017
review_body: ** UPDATED FOR JUNE 2017, scroll down to read ** Bought twice. The first time I ordered a bottle I got Liquid Phyto-Capsules, the second time I ordered I recived capsules that seemed to either have powder in them or the liquid has dried up. The date on the bottle says 10/19, so I'm pretty sure they're not expired. I've been taking them like I normally would, but it's just...odd, because I know they're not supposed to look like this (unless they've changed?). I will still order these, I'm just confused. Hopefully I won't get sick or anything, I have 34 capsules left and I take two every morning.UPDATE: 6/12/17So I ordered another bottle a few days ago and received the bottle, to which on the box it stated that it was a new and improved formula. The capsules looked exactly like the ones that inspired me to write this review, they looked like the capsules in the picture. So the company finally got around to making it official that they changed the formula, on the box. I can't say for sure if this new formula works better than the old one, as I was sure that they were onto something with the liquid inside the capsule. Oh well. I ordered the elderberry syrup as well (not the nighttime one) and I take that sometimes when I need the extra help and want the benefits of having the liquid. So I guess just be aware that there's the change to the formula. Too bad they couldn't have just made another version of this capsule and kept this one with liquid inside. But I guess they know what they're doing.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
review_body: My friend's twin sister, a midwife, recommended this to us two years ago and since then it's helped boost my immunity to every sniffle that comes around, and has made my allergies more manageable. I love this stuff. There's an increasing amount of scientific literature proving the efficacy of elderberry extract in immunity boosting. Amazon has the best prices on Gaia (60 for the price of 30 at Whole Foods), and the capsules are easy to swallow, whereas the syrup is very, very sweet and can be off putting. All of that being said, after six months of ordering it, I have to share this photo of the packaging to shame Amazon into a less wasteful shipping method. The box of capsules in a bubble wrap lined envelope would work just as well.

review_title: I don't feel any better. Nor worse. I haven't been sick, though. So... maybe they do help?
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
review_body: I've been taking these for quite some time. I honestly don't know if they help any. I don't feel any better. Nor worse. I haven't been sick, though. So... maybe they do help? I used to make my own elderberry syrup for years, but got tired of it as I couldn't deal with all the sweetness of the honey. I am not big on sweets. It was a torture taking it. ( And alcohol tincture bothered my stomach. ) So I decided to try these. It is easier to take. And not sweet. Nor it upsets my stomach. I like to think they do help keeping my immune system strong and in perfect working order.

review_title: Who knew the benefits of black elderberry....
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
review_body: I have an autoimmune disease called Sarcoidosis that affects my lungs.  I get a lot of mucus build up and non-stop episodes of coughing.  On a whim, I was doing some Google-ing and found the recommendation for black elderberry.  I of course headed over to my favorite store (Amazon) and found the Gaia capsules, ordered a bottle to give them a try.  Wow!  They seem work almost instantaneously to break up the mucus and help to suppress the coughing.  I don't need to take them every day but I have reordered them twice and will continue to order to keep them in my cabinet.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
review_body: A coworker of mine put me onto this. She brought me a tincture that she got from a local nutrition place in my town for me to try and I had to RUN to find some of my own. Hers was very bitter tasting, like a shot of vodka, so I was worried about that but THIS is pleasant in comparison. I did get the alcohol free bottle. It‚Äôs got a slightly sweet taste. Almost almondy. I tried a tad bit plain just to see. I did mix the vial dose in my tea and it was actually kind of a nice  subtle addition to sweeten it up. The tea I used is Celestial brand, Bengal Spice. Will be perfect if you like cinnamon and ginger. And I do already feel the calming effects of it. I gave four stars because I can‚Äôt speak for how my osteoarthritis, plantar fasciitis and over all body pain will respond to it yet.  I do however, look forward to seeing how this works for my anxiety in the long term as that was the sole reason for my purchase.

review_title: An amazing herb tinctured by a great brand in my opinion...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
review_body: This stuff has worked really well for me. Just so happens I'm taking this right now as I'm writing this review. A couple months ago I had originally bought the same exact tincture and brand at a holistic store located four hours from where I live. I don‚Äôt travel as often as I would like and so I ended up ordering this brand from amazon. Typically I just squirt this stuff into my cup of water.I've read how well ashwagandha works on improving energy and dismissing stress which was a major reason for me to try this. I'm glad I did. Something to keep in mind is, most herbs take a couple of weeks to a month to start affecting the human body. Depends on who you are, sometimes the effects are faster and sometimes it might take longer. Sometimes a different plant might work better. So keep experimenting.In my case, I started seeing the results I was looking for within two weeks. I‚Äôm taking fewer naps because I have more energy to use. I‚Äôve actually been taking this for months now and a few weeks ago I started a second job. I‚Äôm a big sap because I have a very low tolerance to stress. Working two jobs is something I never imagined I could do because of my low stress tolerance. And yet here I am, just passing my second week with keeping two jobs and there‚Äôs still some energy to spare. I‚Äôm very surprised to feel only a minimum of stress. It‚Äôs very insignificant especially compared to where I originally was and that was when I had only one job. Now I‚Äôm often working double shifts a day and I‚Äôm feeling pretty good. I still get an occasional bout of anxiety, usually when I forget to take the ashwaganda, but it‚Äôs not nearly as often or as crippling as it has been in the past.As a little side note, I have depression and anxiety and I often feel as if I‚Äôm in a mental fog. Within just minutes of taking it I feel as if the fog has lifted. Lately I‚Äôve been able to think clearer and with a little more focus. A pleasant surprise considering it took a couple of weeks to finally see an increase in energy.I love it, and I plan with continuing to purchase this tincture.

name: Herb Pharm Organic Valerian Root Liquid Extract, Alcohol-Free: Sleep & Relaxing, Calming Nighttime Sleep Support Supplement, Sugar-Free Herbal Supplement, 1 Oz
description: Herb Pharm Certified Organic Valerian root extract works with the body's natural mechanisms to support relaxation and restful sleep*. Herb Pharm prepares Valerian extract from fresh (never dried) rhizome & roots of Valeriana officinalis plants which are Certified Organically Grown on our own farm. To assure optimal extraction of Valerian's bioactive compounds, the rhizome & roots are hand-harvested in autumn or spring and are then promptly extracted while still fresh and succulent. Valerian is bitter sharp and aromatic. It may be added to water or other liquid for taste and is easily absorbed into the bloodstream. Herb Pharm never uses synthetic solvents. The company's farm is Certified Organic, Bee Friendly, and Salmon Safe. Herb Pharm is the #1 selling liquid herbal extract brand in US Natural Food (SPINS). Herb Pharm is a company of herbalists, scientists, and farmers in GMO-free Josephine County, OR. There, they have been cultivating herbs with care, precision, and respect for nature since 1979. *These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.
features: HERBAL ORGANIC SLEEP SUPPLEMENT: Experience restful sleep support with our organic Valerian root extract, a liquid herbal extract designed to promote relaxation. Ideal for those seeking a gentle calm nighttime sleep without harsh ingredients.* | CALMING VALERIAN ROOT EXTRACT WITH QUICK ABSORPTION: Our sleep support supplement is in an easily absorbed liquid form, ensuring relaxation and a restful sleep.* | CERTIFIED & POTENT NIGHTTIME SUPPLEMENT: Prepared from the Certified Organic fresh rhizome and root of Valeriana officinalis plants on our USA farms, we create a high-quality Valerian root tincture for a calming supplement.* | HIGH-QUALITY & RESPONSIBLE - Enjoy the peace of mind with an alcohol-free, vegan, non-GMO, & gluten-free Valerian root tincture. Offering up to 42 nights of restful sleep support per 1 oz bottle, suitable for daily use.* | VALERIAN SLEEP SUPPLEMENT FOR ADULTS - Not just supporting your sleep, our Valerian root for sleep aligns with healthy lifestyles, supporting relaxation. It's free from additives and made from clean ingredients.*
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
review_body: IDK if its placebo or what.. the moment I take drops of this thing I can sense a calmness and relaxtion. It has helped me calm my nerves and sleep like a baby. First day i took it three times a day.. second i felt better so i took it an hour before sleep and one more right before bed. Since then  I only need to take it before bed.. it has really helped me feel out of a funk i've been in for days. Currently buying my second bottle to keep at work.

review_body: This is the only product I've used that helps me fall asleep, stay asleep, and does not make me feel groggy in the morning. Warning though, it doesn't taste the best, but it's derived from a root, so I wasn't expecting much. I usually mix it with a sip of water, throw it back, and chase it with another sip of water.I love that it works quickly, but I can still function if my kids need me. I've not experienced any side effects or adverse effects.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2016
review_body: I habe been taking valerian for a while intermittently to help me sleep. The liquid works better and faster than pill form. I was so thrilled to fund some affordable ones on amazon because it's difficult to justify a trip to sprouts for just one item and I have 2 small kids to tote around. This is a great quality product. It doesn't habe the alcohol burn like some Valerian liquids do. It does taste terrible when you first use it, but it doesn't really bother me. You kinda ha e to experiment with how much you need, I usually use about 1/4 to 1/2 of the dropper to get the effect I want.  This is also good for headaches and for relaxing as well. It works well for me as a sleep aid. I take it 30 minutes before I intend to go to sleep and it works amazingly!  No groggy feeling in the morning unless I took too much, but it's not like taking a sleeping pill or benadryl sort of groggy. I've never missed my alarm or slept til noon with this. Like I said experiment with how much you need. A while dropper full was too much for me and I'm slim,  5'6, in my mid 30s, for a reference, if size plays a part or just show tolerant you are with sleep aids.  Hope this helps!  Gove it a try, I promise it's worth it for a good night's sleep!!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
review_body: I can't remember when I started using this Valerian product. I'm not a good flyer, and that's probably the reason I tried it the first time. If you get a bit anxious about getting locked into a "bus" with 200 strangers and taken up to 30 or 40 thousand feet, I suggest you try this Valerian. You will probably have to try how much to take depending on your size, height, etc. I would suggest you try it out on the ground first. And of course you should always check with your physician, and check out any interaction possibilities with anything else, medications, alcohol, etc. I find it helpful for many stressful situations; but anything like this, herbal or not, is a very personal choice. I find this to be a mild herbal helper for all types of stressful situations. Also, I have not found it to be addictive. It's just there when I need it. Honestly, sometimes i forget to take it, and I learn that I was more courageous than I gave myself credit for. Do your due diligence checking it out for yourself first. For some people it is a great help.

brand: HawaiiPharm Rhodiola Liquid Extract, Organic Rhodiola (Rhodiola Rosea) Tincture 4 oz
name: HawaiiPharm Rhodiola Liquid Extract, Organic Rhodiola (Rhodiola Rosea) Tincture 4 oz
description: Rhodiola rosea is a perennial plant of the high altitudes of the northernmost reaches of Norway, Sweden, Finland, Iceland, China, Mongolia, and Russia, and also of Tibet. It bears spikes of blue-green leaves bearing a single yellow flower that blooms during the brief arctic summer. The plant grows in areas up to 2280 meters elevation. Several shoots grow from the same thick root. Shoots reaches 5 to 35 cm in height. Rhodiola rosea is dioecious ‚Äì having separate female and male plants.
features: Rhodiola tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality Rhodiola liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | Super concentrated Rhodiola rosea extract: dry material / menstruum ratio 1:3! | We strictly use only organic or ethically sourced wild harvested material, organic alcohol, vegetable glycerin and crystal clear water! Really the BEST Rhodiola extract on market! Made with love for plants and respect for Nature!

review_body: This was my 3rd time ordering. My prior 2 were the smaller bottles. The second one I bought seems to have gone rancid fairly quick so I figured I would replace it sooner and with the larger volume.I opened this bottle and noticed it was much lighter than the prior 2 bottles I have had. It was almost straight alcohol. Very disappointed.

review_title: taste isnt that bad; 10:1 concentration is the strongestest I've found
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
review_body: it isn't sweet like some others, but its not that bad. reading the reviews I thought it would be terrible tasting &/or bitter. It DOES taste a heck of a lot better than lemon balm in alcohol! I would describe it as neutral in terms of sweetness with a pronounced herby quality. For what I need it for, its great!Both bottle & dropper are glass.the 10:1 concentration is very strong; more than the 3:1 I used to use & way stronger than the 1:3 my neighborhood organic foods grocery sells. I cannot see throught the 10:1 in the dropper; it looks more see thru in the other concentrations, esp. in the 1:3the bottle reccomends 30 drops per serving which I've found is just shy of a 1/4 tsp (so about a 1/4 tsp measure full with a very concave meniscus)value-wise then, this stuff is a bargan.

review_body: Bought this as a supplement to unwind after a long day and feel ready for bed a bit earlier than i tend to get to bed but unfortunately it didn't do anything and the taste was terrible. review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
review_body: This product has a significant impact on putting me to sleep. 15 drops (3/4 serving) gets me ready to pass out in about 30-45 minutes. I have always been a good sleeper once asleep, but my smart watch is showing I'm sleeping deeper than normal since I started taking the product. So as a sleep aid it has been phenomenal.I need to take about a serving and a half (30 ish drops) to feel the tension relief in my muscles, and then I almost sleep too hard and have a harder time waking up in the morning. A non alcoholic hangover if you would? hahaI feel better in other ways too but it is hard to separate if I feel better because of the product or because I'm not drinking alcohol before bed.My skin looks great, mood is improved, focus is good. All the things.People complain about the price point, and yes, for 1.2 oz $30 seems steep, but if you figure it replaces one alcoholic drink a night, it's already breaking even or saving you money.I put it in a juice and sparkling water drink, and I've never noticed a taste.I'm excited to try their other flavors/versions.

review_title: Not wine, but not NOT wine
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
review_body: As I discovered when I was pregnant, there just is not a substitute for red wine. There are great AF beers and even mocktails, but they just can‚Äôt get the flavor of a great cab without the alcohol. Fast forward and I‚Äôm just trying to ease back on week day consumption (it‚Äôs gained some momentum since 2020) and this is not a bad stand in. It definitely tastes more like an herbal tea than wine, but it‚Äôs pleasant. I‚Äôm experimenting with adding 2 droppers full to some room temperature sparkling water and a splash of no sugar added cranberry juice. It looks pretty in the glass, tastes ok, and I do feel more relaxed after drinking. I would say if you‚Äôre hesitating because of the price, just go for it and play around with how to take it. It‚Äôs definitely cheaper than 6 bottles of wine.

review_title: Works for Lyme Disease and coinfections
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
review_body: There aren't many reviews for this product yet so I'm sharing my experience and the experiences of two other people I know that take this Cryptolepis because I believe that this is a high quality product that may help those with Lyme Disease or other infections.I was taking Montana Farmacy's Cryptolepis for Lyme Disease because that brand seemed to be a trusted source with plenty of positive reviews. I can't say that I noticed any difference while taking it myself. Fast forward a few months and someone I know was diagnosed with Lyme and asked me for some herbal recommendations. Amazon was out of the Montana Farmacy brand at that time so I searched and found this one instead. It's made in the USA and 3rd party lab tested so I felt that it was safe to try. This person had a definite herx reaction from taking this Cryptolepis.  The Lyme literate doctor that they see felt that this was a very positive sign that the Cryptolepis was working.I decided to try this brand myself and I can definitely tell that it's stronger and making a difference. It has a 1:3 menstruum ratio vs the 1:5 ratio of Montana Farmacy.  I noticed an increase in fatigue with this brand at first as it started fighting the Lyme bacteria. Now that I've been taking it for a few weeks, I'm feeling noticeably better and more energized even with a low dose.I've also recommended this brand to a second person with Lyme Disease and other coinfections. They were taking a different Cryptolepis and they feel that Secrects of the Tribe Cryptolepis is much better than what they were taking previously.I highly recommend giving this product a try if you're considering it. Just be careful not to take too much at first because it's strong stuff. Start as slow as one drop a day if necessary based on your reaction.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
review_body: Shame on these companies for watering down medicine.I have a debilitating, deadly illness and I have been buying this brand of cryptolepsis for a few weeks now. I have spent a good deal of money with this company.. It has been high quality medicine. This is not supposed to taste good, it's medicine.I purchased two bottles this time. One bottle was their regular high quality, bitter, highly effective product. The second bottle was watered down and I could barely taste it. I need more of this immediately otherwise I will start having seizures, difficulty breathing, lose my memory again and much more. It is very upsetting when these companies water down their products that we use as medicine.So now I am trying to figure out how to source a large amount of high quality cryptolepsis root in order to make my own tinctures. I've tried a few different brands of this tincture and they simply don't work. This brand had been the best, and I buy it because it ships quickly. I can't afford to wait a week or a week and a half.So I'm going to buy it one last time, and if the next bottle is similarly weak and watered down, and doesn't really taste that bitter, and doesn't really help my health, I give up.You guys are going to lose a loyal customer to try and what, save a few bucks?

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
review_body: I don't usually believe in this sort of product. Often feeling as though the effects the people endorsing it describe are all in their head or that they are exaggerating.I can tell you my experience. I have had some sort of congestion for several months  that wouldn't allow me to get a full breath. It felt like I was breathing through a towel most of the time. I was coughing and producing some stuff, but it never felt clear. It seemed to actually be getting worse. I'm a singer and it also put a really bad hole in my range where I could sing above and below but couldn't hit the inbetween.I received this yesterday. I was skeptical, but the reviews were so good (including from decades long smokers) so, I filled the included glass dropper to the 1ml mark as there were not instructions beyond that I could use it 3 times a day.I squirted the substance under my tounge and held it there for a 10 count before swallowing.30 min later, (I'll try not to be too graphic) but I produced a larger than usual volume by a startling amount and this happened a few more times over the next half an hour, finally culminating in a coughing fit that ended with...A breath of fresh air that felt like I had been under water and finally reached the surface. Ecstatic doesn't begin to describe my mood.I took one other dose at the end of the day. This morning I was singing with only a few minor notes that were difficult BUT NO LONGER IMPOSSIBLE to hit. I feel like those too will get better in short order simply because I haven't been able to practice them.I was hitting vibrato I couldn't dare to try yesterday...it's not a miracle. But it's far more than I ever expected much faster than i could have dreamed. 0 doubt in my mind this product works!On top of that, it actually tastes pretty good. I would have eaten cardboard to get this result, and still given it a 5 star review. So can I add a 6th star?

review_title: Liquid gold for generalized anxiety and panic disorder.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2020
review_body: As the headline reads I have both generalized anxiety and panic disorder and I‚Äôve been dealing with it all of my life. As someone who has been on many medications over the years with often negative repercussions I‚Äôm very much for the natural approach of diet, exercise, Therapy, and supplements.This is not my first herbpharm  tincture I first bought the chamomile and lemonbalm. I was already comfortable using this when I bought it I just didn‚Äôt realize how amazing it was for anxiety until recently when I started having crippling panic attacks again at the end of February. As someone who took Clonopin for more than six years, and then had to spend a year withdrawing and coming off of it I have to say this tincture gives me just as much relief. Without any of the side effects of withdrawal symptoms. That‚Äôs enough to be a win in my book. It‚Äôs reasonably priced it lasts a fairly long time you can also buy a 4 ounce bottle which I love as an option. I‚Äôve known about this for years and like I said I‚Äôve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however I‚Äôve known about this for years and like I said I‚Äôve used some of the other ones I have for sleep and for anxiety this has worked the best for me however. I originally bought this one for sleep. I have since ordered it two more times. I don‚Äôt actually noticed any sedative affects like some others have mentioned. Everyone is different And is affected differently so that‚Äôs important to keep in mind. It sucks to see the reviews bad mouthing these herb farm products for potency and what not. Your time would be better spent making a tincture of your own at home instead of writing reviews for products that work for hundreds of other people. I‚Äôm so happy I found this and it gives me hope that my anxiety and more so my panic attacks aren‚Äôt going to take over my life.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016
review_body: This stuff is now a staple and a "need" in my home! My first time trying was a gift from my sister, who insisted I try it! So, this is my second bottle, and I must say, I am impressed!It's not a "cure all" for anxiety, of course. I have chronic anxiety so I knew going in this wouldn't be a cure for that. But it has helped tremendously. It definitely takes the edge off, helps me to be able to take deeper breaths, takes the chest pain away, and makes my heart stop racing! I usually take it 1-2 times a day. With such a small bottle I try to keep it to a minimum and use it only when I really need it.It does not taste good, but I dilute it in a small sip of water and down it fast. Chase it with another sip of water, and done. It does not leave a bad aftertaste, especially when you drink water afterward.I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone with any form of anxiety. Like I said, it's not a cure all, but it does take the edge off!

review_title: Natural and for most folks, relaxing and perhaps sleep-inducing
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2018
review_body: I know for some folks this product works marvelously. But I‚Äôm a difficult case when it comes to falling asleep. If it worked all the time for everybody, then it would be more like a drug. I use other similar products, such as Puritan's PrideCALM TABS that contains Valerian extract, Passion flower extract, hops, and a few other ingredients. Usually they help, but not always. And in the day if I have tension, I prefer a cup of hot tea with half-and-half, even black tea is soothing.Some folks claim that passion flower induces more vivid dreams. Maybe it does. But that‚Äôs the last thing I need!

review_title: but not bad. I generally need a Trazadone to get me ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_body: There's definitely a noticeable relaxant effect.The taste is... herbal, but not bad. I generally need a Trazadone to get me to sleep, and then I have to discipline myself into relaxing so it can work. With this, even more so than valerian, falling asleep is an eventuality more than a choice (although I used about 3x the suggested dose before I felt much).Like a lot of extracts, this has a heavy alcohol component. I put it in a glass of cheap bota box red; the flavor was very strong and herbal--I actually really enjoyed the taste but I'm a little weird about herbal flavoring in liqueur and wine, so don't trust me on that really.Bottom line, if sleep hygiene doesn't work for you, try melatonin on a strict regime. If that doesn't work, try it and Valerian. If that doesn't work, try melatonin and this.This is powerful in a normally adult way: you'll get sleepy, very sleepy. Nothing fun, just a kind of expensive alternative to waiting on insurance.If sleep I'd the goal, go forth. Otherwise? Just know this is a sleepy drug, not a party drug.

review_body: A friend recommended the HerbPharm brand a few years ago. I have used nothing else since.What I like best about their brand is that they offer standardized tinctures, which means you're always getting the same dosage every time you buy a bottle.I bought the passionflower for relaxing. It's easy on the body, and I know each time I take it I'm getting the same dosage.While everything they sell is all natural, make sure you do your research. These are medicines, and should be treated as such.

review_title: It's more like a sleeping aide and I would not recommend for any other reason
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
review_body: I took less than the recommended dose, and it did not have the effect of reducing anxiety. It did, however, include being drowsy and forgetful. I took this late in the morning, and after an hour, I got sleepy and took a nap at noon. I then woke up with a slight headache and slight confusion. Thus, this might be helpful for sleeping but not for reducing stress. I recommend looking up the side effects of taking passionflower. This paragraph did take me a while to write as I am still under the effects of it.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2014
review_body:
I was prescribed this extract by my doctor to see if it helped with my hot flashes that were completely out of control. Within 2 weeks of twice daily usage they disappeared, yippee! As a side bonus, with continued use, it also seems to have taken care of heart palpitations I used to get around 3 am.m, upon waking and randomly during the day. My doc doesnt seem to think this is a normal response, but I will take it! I used 2 droppers 2x daily to have this effect, and the 4 oz bottle lasts me about a month at this dosage.Unfortunately I did not have as good luck with it helping my insomnia. I use 2 droppers ? ~40 drops at bedtime. Maybe more would show a benefit.As a side note, the extract works much better for me than taking capsules, even if I take the capsules apart and take the powder in some water.UPDATE Dec2014 - I found if I take 6 droppers half full at bedtime it works great on my insomnia. I just tried Gaia phyto-gels caps
  
Gaia Herbs Passion Flower Liquid Phyto-Capsules, 60 Count







  
  
    and am up to 3 at night with no success/sleepiness, so I may need to switch back to the HerbPharma liquid here.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
review_body: I bought this as well as the Lavander oil from herb pharm. My friend who is a naturopathic doctor recommended me to pour three squeezes of each into my water/preferred beverage- she said 4 squeezes should be the maximum amount I use though. I decided to give this product four stars because for whatever reason, it does not calm my anxiety down ALL the time. Sometimes I feel as if it made absolutely no difference, whereas other times I DEFINITELY DO feel that it‚Äôs kicking in and working. That to me right there says a lot, because I have tried TONS of natural supplements before in the past to help cope with my anxiety, and NONE of them did a single thing for me & I'm not one to fall for placebos. I‚Äôm very satisfied with Herb Pharm‚Äôs lavander & Passion flower oils- I just wish they worked ALL the time. I feel like when I don‚Äôt take it after 2-5 days they work better. However, if I‚Äôm using it everyday, I don‚Äôt feel like the results are as great. Either way, something is better than nothing- definitely recommend! Lol

review_title: The best sleep aid I've ever used
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
review_body: My acupuncturist recommended this blend, and I was worried it might leave me "hungover" in the morning, because I tend to be very sensitive to such things, but it doesn't at all! I'm in a stressful season of life and was having a hard time sleeping more than 4-5 hours a night, so I would feel really "crunchy" during the day, and then wired-tired at night. This spray has not only helped me look forward to good sleep every night, it has also "softened" my nervous system so even when I'm light on sleep (due to external circumstances now rather than internal ones) I don't get that crunchy feeling. I keep it next to my bed and take it nightly (along with magnesium glycinate). It tastes great! Like cardamom.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
review_body: Everything in relation to your health is about chemistry. What works for one person doesn't work for another. Everything you ingest from drinks, food or medications it's all chemistry. I tried all kinds of herbals and prescription medications and nothing works without side effects. I get incredibly sick from Melatonin and other things I tried leave me feeling groggy or with a terrible migraine. I have a very sensitive system.I'm happy I found this because it works with my chemistry. One negative about it for me is bothers my throat a little. I wish it wasn't made with alcohol but maybe the herbs chemistry work better by being extracted with alcohol.The final result is ....I slept like a baby!

review_title: Helps me fall asleep when I can't go to sleep
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_body: Herb Pharm has another winner! I rated this five stars for the formula as opposed to the delivery mechanism. I take the sprayer out and use a dropper to add it to water. The suggested use is to keep it by your bed and spray without getting up. I prefer to mix it with a little water as the spray was a bit intense for my tongue. Otherwise, the formula is great! Most sleep herbs are bitter and unpleasant. This is the best I've used so far and the flavor is decent. When I'm tossing and turning and can't get to sleep or get back to sleep, this helps do the trick. Thanks, Herb Pharm! I'm happy to be supporting a "local" company here in Oregon.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
review_body: Desperately wanted this to work. I have lifelong insomnia and have a closet larger than a pharmacy filled with sleep remedies from homeopathic, herbal, Chinese medicine, sprays, essential oils, and at least 15 other types of natural remedies to help me sleep. You name it -- it is in my closet.  I can get to sleep pretty well most nights without any help, but I wake up at 3:00 a.m. and then am up for the rest of the night. Doesn't matter if I hit the sack at 9:00 p.m. or 1:00 a.m.  I am up at 3:00 a.m. for the day. This was approximately my 20th try at a natural remedy for insomnia and it did not work for me. I am writing this after using it for 30 days -- every night as directed. The taste is OK for me since I am used to Chinese herbs which are horrible to taste. But this did not work -- I was up at 3:15 a.m. every night -- so maybe it gave me an extra 15 minutes before I was wide awake for the day.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2015
review_body: Skullcap is amazing.  I have severe social anxiety as well as anxiety for any other situation.  I was on anti-depressants from age 15 to 21, then I had a child and didn't want to get back on prescription medication.  I make my own gel capsules using the tincture and usually take one to two depending on the severity of the situation.  This does not make me feel groggy or fatigued in anyway, but i have heard that it can in some people.  In my opinion the feeling it gives you is sort of like taking a shot of alcohol, in the way that it calms your nerves.  I recommend this to everyone but some people are hesitant because it doesn't effect you the way prescription anti-depressants or anti-anxiety medication does, which is a good thing I think.  You really have to let your body "open up" and allow it to work to notice a difference.

review_title: Excellent calming agent and pain manager
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2014
review_body: Excellent calming agent and pain manager!!!  The quality of Herb Pharm is the BEST!!  Using this along with Crampbark by Herb Pharm, I have completely stopped using OTC pain medicine for everything.  The combination of the two can beat any pain that I've had...other than the nerve pain associated with my herniated disk.  It has worked for headaches, menstrual cramps, spastic colon/IBS...and on most of my back and joint pain.  It does not make me tired but does make me more relaxed.  The taste is not a problem.UPDATE: I have discovered Jamaica Dogwood from Herb Pharm and I highly suggest it to all pain sufferers!!! I combine it with cramp bark for severe pain. I still use the Skullcap...but more for pain when I'm trying to relax or sleep...or just to relax. Jamaica Dogwood works on all pain including nerve pain. I finally can live pain-free with my herniated disk. When I recently started to get a flair up of sciatica (caused by herniated disk), I combined it with willow bark also from Herb Pharm, which is an anti-inflammatory (not to be used with any NSAIDs), which caused my sciatica to almost completely go away in 1 hour of taking the first dose. With in 4 days of using the combination my sciatica was GONE...instead of 30 chiropractor visits and tons of physical therapy which used to take up to 4 months to heal. You gotta' love herbs!!!

review_title: A great reliever for mild anxiety
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2016
review_body: I've spent the last several years working very high stress, technical jobs in startups. And ooohhh man does the anxiety just get worse over time. Over longer periods of stress, certain minerals in your body can be depleted, leaving you more and more anxious and stressed out. Obviously mineral replenishment and the restoration of adrenal function is your end goal, but that takes time.In the meantime, I've found that a few drops of skullcap when I've stressed out helps take the edge off. As with anything, overuse can be problematic and have side effects. But a few drops of this helps calm me temporarily. It's not going to have prescription strength powers..... but it'll be safer and have fewer side effects and issues on your overall bodily symptoms if you have milder bouts of anxiety.I also like to use this before bedtime to help calm my racing mind and get to sleep. My preference is valerian, but using that too frequently can cause it to use it's effectiveness. So I like to alternate out between skullcap and valerian, combined with hops, to actually get a good nights sleep. Enough sleep can help your body better manage your cortisol levels (created as a response to stress).  Out of balance cortisol can lead to a host of other problems, including weight gain.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021
review_body: I did quite a bit of reading/research on Skullcap, and the difference in American & Chinese. (This one is American). I started as per the directions: 1 dropper/dose, 3 times per day. I was feeling sleepy (pleasantly) too early in the day. I cut back to 2 doses per day, afternoon and evening. Still more sleepy than I wanted in the late afternoon. Now, if I'm not going out, I have 1 dropper before dinner, and 1 at bedtime. If I'm going out in the early evening for dinner or a gathering, I take only 1 dropper at bedtime. This works well for me. It definitely does feel somewhat "sedating", but in much more pleasant a manner than ANY pill. Plus, my favorite part is the feeling of refreshing wakefulness in the morning, no grogginess. One suggestion, I would avoid taking it at all if you have consumed any alcoholic beverages on that day.

review_body: This is working great for me. I have migraines and tension headaches, and also have some trouble with insomnia. This has helped on all fronts. I do not take the full dose, but only about 7 drops at night. If I have a headache in the morning, I start with 5 drops, and sometimes add a few drops of Herb Pharm's White Willow Bark. OTC painkillers have never done much for my headaches, but this takes them right away. If I wake up in the middle of the night, I take about 5 drops along with some L-theanine, and usually can go right back to sleep.I would suggest starting with just 2-3 drops and working up from there. It seems to be pretty strong stuff.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2017
review_body: I have tried for 3 years to get off Ambien sleep medication. I tried cuttapering back, but it never worked. Then I read about Skullcap, bought this and the loose tea, but I have yet to try the loosetea as this is so much easier. I began taking it, without lowering my dosage. I waited a week, and then I began cutting down my pills, each time taking that dosage for a week. What I noticed the first week and it continues this way, is I feel relaxed and sleep longer. If I awake in the middle to the night with any problems, I take another dropper full, but that is seldom. Last night I got down to just scraping off just  a little of my Ambien pill, that it was just psychological that I needed it. . Finally, I realize now that I can sleep without Ambien. I will continue to buy this to have when we take trips. This product needs to be advertised more. I found out about when I got on a forum where others were trying to get off sleeping pills. I have never had such good night sleeps and days where I felt energized. I have a new life.

review_body: I tried this skullcap four times, over extended periods of time, to make sure. Each and every time, it just does not work for me. I don't get it. It's like it's missing the active ingredient or something. I'm going back to my original brand of skullcap that works great.  I was trying this because it's organic, but what's the point if it doesn't work.  I've tried a few other things from this company and I just don't have good luck at all. Nope.

features: Liquid herbal extract to support, restore and tone the nervous system.* | Easily absorbed liquid engages your senses of taste and smell to help your body recognize & use herbs. | Prepared from Certified-Organic, fresh Scutellaria lateriflora plants grown on our own southern Oregon farms. | Vegan, non-GMO, & gluten-free. Herb identity assured via HPTLC fingerprinting and other methods specific to each herb. | * This statement has not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2016
review_body: I took this for the first time last night.  What a night!  I took it to help with sleep and pain.  I will say that it most definitely made me sleepy and I did find it calming.  However, for me it appears to be dangerous.  I woke up a couple hours after taking it.  I saw lights on under the bedroom doors (one leads to a hall and one to a laundry room).  It took me a long time to figure out where I was in the room.  I knew I was in the room in the bed, but didn't know where in the room the bed was located.  I then realized that I was upside down and half-off the mattress.  Not at all like me, I don't move much.  I got up and went to the bathroom and when I came back the lights under the door were not on.  I asked my husband who was in the basement playing a computer game and he said no lights were on to his knowledge.  So I don't know what happened!  I think I was half-asleep when I got up.  I ended up sleeping until 9 this morning but I have been groggy all day.  I should note that I am very sensitive to medications so it stands to reason that I would be with herbs as well.  But after reading about some issues with Skullcap and possible liver problems, I'm going to discontinue it.  Tonight I'm trying the Jamaican Dogwood.  I'll post about that one tomorrow.  By the way, I love Herb Pharm and have not been sick all year, which I believe is due to using their Mullein Blend.  I would not hesitate to purchase that one.

review_title: Pura Herba Goldenseal Root Liquid Extract - organic, made in USA, very affordable
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2024
review_body: We use more than a couple supplements. It's not always possible to know how well each is working individually when taken with others. Over the years I have learned to use the label and the ad to judge the quality of a supplement. I use not only what IS there, but also what isn't there.Pura Herba GoldensealPROS:Ingredients are organic.No fillers or chemical preservatives. (None are needed as glycerin is a preservative.)Gives a lot of info, a lot that many should but don't. Pure Herba used dried root and a menstrum ratio of 1:3. I've made extracts and I really appreciate the information.In an amber glass bottle.Extract is made in USA, and the information is on the label. No looking through a miles long ad or posting a question to find out.$15 for 85 servings is 18¬¢ per serving.CONS:Uses the term tincture to identify this glycerite. Glycerites are made with glycerite, tinctures are made with alcohol, so when they put say it's an alcohol free tincture on the label, it's an oxymoron , a sign of either an uninformed manufacturer or the manufacturer thinking their consumer is uninformed. Both tinctures and glycerites are extracts, but the terms are not interchangeable. Call it what it is, a glycerite extract.

review_title: Pura Herba Goldenseal Root Extract - A Great Herb, Info Missing From the Manufacturer
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
review_body: Goldenseal is a native plant of North America and has a long rich history of use by Native Americans who long understood the significance of this golden root. Rich in alkaloids mixed with flavonoids this herb is known to be antimicrobial, a natural antibiotic, anti-inflammatory and has many uses in herbal preparations. There are also concerns that due to its popularity, it is being over harvested. That being said this herb is a premier herb to have in your herbal cabinet.That being said, I can judge this bottle of Goldenseal only by the information given on the listing and on the bottle. It is said to be organic but is not certified and is prepared in the USA by Puraherba, a recently founded company out of Florida. Their website given on the bottle does not exist so it appears to be a startup working to get its products to market quickly through this site. While this lack of information raises some questions, I'm hoping that the information given about the product is accurate.

description: Graviola (Soursop) trees are bushy and low, only about 7.5-9 m tall. Young branchlets are rusty-hairy. The smooth, glossy, dark green leaves are oblong to elliptical and pointed at both ends. Solitary flowers emerge anywhere on the trunk, branches or twigs. They are cone shaped, the 3 fleshy outer petals are yellow-green, the 3 inner petals are pale-yellow. The fruit is more or less oval or heart-shaped, though it tends to be lopsided or curved.

name: WILE Un-Anger Tincture for Women - Calm, Focus & Mood Support Supplement with Kava, Chaste Tree Berry & Milk Thistle - Herbal Perimenopause Liquid Drops Supplements for Stress, PMS, Menopause, 1FL oz
features: EFFECTIVE MOOD SUPPORT: WILE Un-Anger Tincture is a 100% plant-derived natural tincture, ideal for stress or anger-provoking events. This herbal tincture supports a healthy stress response and helps calm the body and mind. Great for PMS and helps to reduce irritability, common in midlife. Our Un-anger tincture is perfect for those seeking natural relief for anxiety. | POWERFUL CALMATIVE INGREDIENTS: Infused with soothing Kava root, Milk Thistle, and other concentrated calmers, this tincture mix supports mood during anger and frustration. Kava promotes a healthy mood in response to occasional stress, known for deep relaxation and a calming effect. Milk Thistle helps improve mood and relieve stress, while English Lavender is known to calm the body and mind. Chaste Tree helps relieve physical and emotional symptoms associated with the menstrual cycle. | FAST-ACTING STRESS RELIEF: Get fast support during frustration, anger, and irritability with 1-2 droppers under the tongue, then swallow. These tincture drops have a sharp taste that quickly dissipates and may be added to water, tea, coffee, or your favorite drink. | NATURAL AND SAFE: Our mood support supplement is formulated by naturopath physicians with no side effects. Vegan, gluten-free, non-habit forming, and non-sedative, this mood support tincture promotes a sense of well-being and acts as a mood support supplement and flow drops for energy and focus. | MENOPAUSE SUPPLEMENTS FOR WOMEN 40+: WILE capsules, tinctures, and functional drinks help manage hormones, perimenopause, and stress for women over 40. Includes 1 fl oz. (30 servings). Take up to 3 times a day for menopause support, PMS support, and menopause relief.

review_title: Get the benefits of mushrooms in a few drops
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in Canada on May 20, 2024
review_body: The benefits of mushrooms seems to be becoming more and more popular lately. Using a tincture like this is a great way to get the benefits of mushrooms, such as improving the immune system, sleep quality and stress response. They're easy to take; just a few drops under the tongue or in a small amount of water or other drink. However, tinctures are not known for tasting good. They're usually very UNpleasant. But I find putting the drops under the tongue prevents the taste from being too unpleasant. It also allows it to go straight into the bloodstream. I started off with a lower dose than recommended to be sure I didn't have any reaction to it. And gradually increased to the full recommended dose.  I've been taking a few tinctures and have found them to be beneficial. This is also made by a small Canadian company which I'm happy to support.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in Canada on January 8, 2024
review_body: I have been reading some research on Reishi Mushroom for a while, and there are supposedly a ton of benefits, including cardiovascular benefits and antidepressant properties. I decided to try the liquid and this particular Tincture (mixed with a little alcohol). It's easy to administer, the package says 4 drops a day (or 4 ml), which means this bottle should last 15 days.  However, in the product description, it says to use 2 drops, which means the bottle will last 30 days. Based on my research, I suggest going with 1 or 2 drops a day so that one can analyze if there are any side effects and act accordingly. Once you assess the situation you can probably increase the dosage (or even stop it completely). I'm starting with 2 drops personally and am interested to see if it will affect blood sugar and cholesterol/triglycerides.I didn't taste the drops on their own, but I added them to my tea, I didn't notice any change in taste, though again I'm using 2 drops, so I'm not sure if there will be a difference if one uses 4 drops. You can also add it to food, like a salad, though you probably need to make sure that you eat all the salad serving to make sure you take the dose that you are on. I have high hopes for this product and will continue to consume it for 3 months and go for blood work to see if there are any benefits in the area I discussed above. Though there are other benefits as described in the product description, that I will keep my eye on as well.

review_title: Made in Canada, Tastes Great, Easy to Use!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in Canada on December 31, 2023
review_body: I love products made in Canada and even better when they come in a glass bottle. Includes a dropper (instead of a cap) and measurements up to 1ml so it is very easy to use and get the correct dosage. I'm a firm believer in natural products and using nature to not only sustain us but to repair us as well.It tastes surprisingly pleasant and while I add it to my morning coffee I wanted to know what the actual taste was on it's own and I'm happy to say it's tasty as well as a very light translucent golden colour. Adding it to my morning coffee the taste gets lost so I really don't notice its there.Promotes Better Immune System (which we all want) and Stress Response for a natural calm which in the busy season is a sure blessing! A win win in my book.I'm a little confused as to the dosage as the description says to take 2 dropper full's and each dropper holds 1ml so that would be 2ml. Yet the box it comes in says to take 4ml per adult dosage. And the bottle itself mentions a 4ml serving? So if I take 4ml per serving I would only get 15 servings per bottle. By taking 2ml per serving I will get 30 servings per bottle and if I only want to take 1ml per serving which for me seems reasonable I will get 60 servings so a 2 months supply. Anyhow which ever serving size you prefer to take I believe it will be helpful.I have a strong and healthy immune system as but the stress response for a natural calm is good as my husband says I'm grumpy before I get my coffee and as it goes in my coffee it's a win for both of us. I'm not so young anymore and finding something like this to help keep me calm, relaxed and healthy is great! Love it!Only time will tell as to the overall effect this will have on me and everything responds differently to different folks. But I've always felt mushrooms were good for me and to get the goodness in this tincture which is much more concentrated is wonderful!

review_title: Can't go wrong with this brand!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in Canada on February 11, 2024
review_body: I really love this brand, they‚Äôre doing things right!  I can completely recommend the Forage brand and their tinctures, particularly the Lion's Mane and Reishi variants. If you read up about them on their site, you‚Äôll see why and what I mean. The origin story and their work is awesome. Reishi in particular has an incredible history that‚Äôs worth reading up on. You can‚Äôt say too much about health benefits on sites in general, but if you take a look at it‚Äôs main uses, I feel this has been working to help things for me. I feel it has an ever so slightly minty taste to it. Main thing to know, don‚Äôt waste your money on any mushroom supplement if it doesn‚Äôt clearly specify it‚Äôs made of  fruiting bodies, and talks about beta glucans. I also don‚Äôt bother with supplements unless there‚Äôs an NPN number. Forage covers both of those angles. I also love the brown sunlight protected bottle, and the easy to read dropper.So.. yup! This is a great brand! Give em a try.

review_title: I like this lemon balm BUT...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
review_body: I have ordered this product twice and both times, the cap/dropper cracks after the first time opening it. I have several liquid supplements that come in similar bottles yet I have NEVER had one break. I am not overly rough opening them nor am I so strong there is justification for this to happen. I thought it was a fluke with the 1st bottle so I ordered it again, but when the exact same thing happened again, I knew I need to find a new brand for my lemon balm. The taste is actually not too bad and I didn't mind the product otherwise, though I never really felt a huge amount of calm come to me after using this. My daughter uses it sometimes as well and she says she feels a bit calmer afterwards though.

review_title: Horrible Rotten Taste - In Three Separate Orders!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022
review_body: I loved this product the first time I bought it. The taste was pleasant and sweet, and the effects were relaxing. I purchased again and the second bottle was the same. Then I ordered a third bottle. When it arrived, sealed in its package like the others, I opened it and tried a dropperful. I nearly threw up. It tasted horribly rotten. Like drinking the juices from the bottom of a trash can. I gagged for several minutes and returned it immediately. However, I liked the first bottle so much I decided to try again. So I re-ordered and received another brand new, sealed bottle like the last. Guess what? Same horrible rotten taste. This time I did an exchange, and wrote the seller a note mentioning the horrible taste, and telling them I would not re-order a third time. Lo and behold, the next bottle I received was perfectly fine, just like the first two, with a pleasant sweet taste and calming effect. Thank goodness. All was well, until I finished that bottle and ordered the next one. Once again, I received a rotten bottle. I nearly threw up after half a dropper. It took hours to get the taste out of my mouth.  There were no odd or extenuating circumstances - the packages were well wrapped and safe, undamaged and not left in the sun. All three deliveries were in the fall/winter when temperatures were in the 60s or lower. There was no chance it went bad during transit. There is a huge batch of rotten product sitting in a warehouse somewhere, and they‚Äôre just shipping it out. Probably figuring most people won‚Äôt bother to return it. So far a I‚Äôve had three bad bottles out of six. If you‚Äôre willing to take those odds, by all means order this product. You‚Äôve got a 50% chance of having a very nice experience. Just be ready with a bucket when you have your first taste, in case the coin toss comes up heads and you vomit your guts out instead.

review_title: After using it for one week I don't see any improvements in my sleep.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2014
review_body: Well, all my hopes were shattered. This product doesn't work any better than the regular Melatonin for me, maybe it works for other people. However, I have used it so far only a week and will continue to use it until the bottle is empty (4oz) and will see if I get anything better.

brand: Deep Sleep - Natural Herbal Sleep Aid Supplement - Non-Habit Forming - 4 oz Liquid Extract (Contains Fresh Extracts of California Poppy, Valerian, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lemon Balm

features: Herbs Etc - Deep Sleep 4 oz
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2013
review_body: I use this for sleep. Sleep medications do not really do well with me. So I tried this out along with the other sleep supplements I take. I have to say it seems to help, I read another review where they say if they do wake in middle of night to take a little more, I have done that and am able to get back to sleep much better then before I was using. My sleep has been a bit deeper too, normally I am such a light sleeper and would wake up every hour on the hour, now I can at least for 4 or more hours before waking. I highly recommend trying this for sleep problems, it was worth trying for me.

review_title: I've used this product in years past with good results. I originally purchased it at Whole Foods
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2014
review_body: I've used this product in years past with good results. I originally purchased it at Whole Foods, and had the unique experience of speaking with the product's formulator, who actually created it for his wife's menopausal insomnia and chattery "Monkey Brain". I was having the same symptoms, and still do. I don't use this every night, but when I have spurts of insomnia, I turn to it every time, and it works. Yes, it does not have the most pleasant flavor, but I combine it with Sweet Dreams tea before bed, and then the taste is not bad at all.

brand: Deep Sleep - Natural Herbal Sleep Aid Supplement - Non-Habit Forming - 4 oz Liquid Extract (Contains Fresh Extracts of California Poppy, Valerian, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lemon Balm
name: Deep Sleep - Natural Herbal Sleep Aid Supplement - Non-Habit Forming - 4 oz Liquid Extract (Contains Fresh Extracts of California Poppy, Valerian, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lemon Balm
description: Deep Sleep is made with sleep promoting herbs, including Passionflower, Chamomile and Lemon Balm.
features: Herbs Etc - Deep Sleep 4 oz
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2013
review_body: I have had problems with waking up early. Deep Sleep addresses this some but by itself is not effective for me in that I wake up early still but maybe an hour later than I have (after I have become tolerant to other prescription meds I have been trying.)  If you try it, know that the first couple nights will be very strange, with crazy dreams - this is the best I can describe it. But at least this is not an additive medication. I have since added back the other prescriptions meds one by one and Deep Sleep does seem to potentiate their effect. I have reordered another value-size four ounce bottle from Amazon. It is not the alcohol-free version but that does not bother me and Herbs Etc tells me that the amount of alcohol in the whole bottle does not equal a half glass of wine, if I remember correctly. You might want to check with them directly to be sure, if that is an issue for you.

brand: Deep Sleep - Natural Herbal Sleep Aid Supplement - Non-Habit Forming - 4 oz Liquid Extract (Contains Fresh Extracts of California Poppy, Valerian, Passionflower, Chamomile, Lemon Balm

review_title: IT TASTES LIKE TARNISHED SILVER BUT WORKS LIKE MAGIC !!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2014
review_body: I've written a positve review before on the soft gels, so I thought I'd give the liquid a try, as I also thought it might be more cost effective.NEVER AGAIN !While it has the same potency as the gels, it has the most god-awful taste, akin to licking the inside of tarnished spoon...which I did as a kid and remember vividly.The stopper didn't work well either, not completely filling to the maximum, but only about half-way. I took two of these droppers half-full and slept soundly. Doing so seems to use a greater amount than in the gels, obviously, to achieve the same effect of three gels.Once I'm finished with this review, and even though I have an almost full 4oz bottle left, I'm ordering the gels again. Less mess, no aftertaste, no burping it up to haunt you three hours later, and a better value.PLEEEASE, Herbs Etc., at least add a little pina colada taste to it to make it more palatable.

review_title: Does what it claims to do
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021
review_body: I started using this in the evening to wind down at the end of the day rather than a glass of wine or cocktail. I get the same mood boosting, calming, relaxing benefits that I get from alcohol, but without feeling drunk. It helps me fall asleep quickly without making me feel groggy or sluggish. I sleep more soundly and wake up feeling more rested than I have in years, even without getting adequate hours of sleep. I actually awoke before my alarm clock ready for the day, and I'm usually a heavy snooze button user. The taste is lightly flowery and pleasant. I mix mine with club soda and a splash of lime juice. Refreshing, delicious and soothing. I love this stuff.

brand: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 2 oz
name: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) Liquid Extract 2 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Saint John's Wort (Hypericum Perforatum) is a perennial herbaceous plant up to 30 - 100 cm high. The stalk is dihedral bare in the upper part is oppositely branched. Rhizomes and roots are underdeveloped, unbranched. The leaves are oval or ovoid, with translucent glands in the form of black dots. Petals are strewn with black-brown or purple dots, especially around the edge. The plant blooms in June-August.The fruit is a three-celled oblong-ovate capsule. Seeds are small, cylindrical, brown. The fruits ripen in September-October.

Really the BEST California Poppy and Saint John's Wort extract on market!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_body: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it‚Äôs certified organic too. It‚Äôs fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it‚Äôs hard for me to get a ‚Äúfull‚Äù dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there‚Äôs no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don‚Äôt have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally ‚Äî the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don‚Äôt have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I‚Äôd have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I‚Äôll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it‚Äôs such a strange combination of flavors I‚Äôm not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I‚Äôd prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
review_body: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.

review_title: Difficult to use dropper but seems effective
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
review_body: The dropper on this seems to not want to fill and is very finicky to use. I see other reviewers experienced something similar, so it doesn't appear to be a fluke with my bottle. The formula appears to be effective, but I think it's kind of pricey for what it is.

review_title: Not sure how many benefits it gives but seems fine
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
review_body: Not entirely sure how great of a benefit one gets from the Qat listed here instead of the actual qat used in places like Yemen, but this stuff does not have any acute effects that you will notice immediately. Most importantly, if you're very sensitive to taste, this is definitely one of those "acquired tastes" products, but I generally liked it and thought it was pleasant enough after the initial use. Might have benefits over time, but hard to tell.
